Name: Providing information about free foreclosure prevention assistance.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing information about free foreclosure prevention assistance.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
 
Section 1.  Subdivision a of section 20-740.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new paragraph 6 to read as follows:
6.  Information on obtaining free foreclosure prevention assistance.
Â§2.  This local law shall take effect 90 days after enactment, except that the commissioner of consumer affairs shall take such measures as are necessary for its implementation, including the promulgation of rules, prior to such effective date.
